qas.question: What does Building Partnerships relate to in the Air Force?

answers.text: airmen interacting with international airmen and other relevant actors

qas.question: What are the goals of the Building Partnership interactions?

answers.text: develop, guide, and sustain relationships for mutual benefit and security

qas.question: What sort of inter-personal relationships does Building Partnerships encourage?
What is the major goal of Building Partnerships in these deeds and actions?

answers.text: building trust-based relationships for mutual benefit

qas.question: What are Airmen expected to be competent in for these Building Partnerships missions?

context: Building Partnerships is described as <a0_0>airmen interacting with international airmen and other relevant actors<a0_0/> to <a1_0>develop, guide, and sustain relationships for mutual benefit and security<a1_0/>. Building Partnerships is about interacting with others and is therefore an inherently inter-personal and <a2_0>cross-cultural<a2_0/> undertaking. Through both words and deeds, the majority of interaction is devoted to <a3_0>building trust-based relationships for mutual benefit<a3_0/>. It includes both foreign partners as well as domestic partners and emphasizes collaboration with foreign governments, militaries and populations as well as US government departments, agencies, industry, and NGOs. To better facilitate partnering efforts, Airmen should be competent in the <a4_0>relevant language, region, and culture<a4_0/>.
